intro: Psychotria antsalovensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
